input_text:
Job Title: Shipping Clerk

Location: Visalia, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Business Unit Overview

Headquartered in Lakeville, Minn., Post Consumer Brands, a business unit of Post Holdings, Inc., is dedicated to providing people and their pets with delicious food choices for every taste and budget. The company’s portfolio includes beloved brands such as Honey Bunches of Oats®, PEBBLES®, Grape-Nuts® and Malt-O-Meal® cereal, and Peter Pan® peanut butter, as well as Rachael Ray® Nutrish®, Kibbles ‘n Bits® and 9Lives® dog and cat food. As a company committed to high standards of quality and to our values, we are driven by one idea: To make lives better by making delicious food accessible for all. For more information about our brands, visit www.postconsumerbrands.com and follow us on LinkedIn for the latest news.

Brand

It’s an exciting time in pet food! Post Holdings, Inc., recently announced an agreement to acquire Perfection Pet Foods, a leading manufacturer of private label and co-manufactured pet food and baked treats. The transaction is anticipated to close by the end of the calendar year in 2023. This role is part of the Perfection Pet Foods team of 250+ employees who will soon join the Post family to help grow the pet food business.

Location Description

Visalia, CA is home to 360,000 square feet of manufacturing, packaging, warehouse, and office space. Approximately 250 employees work here, utilizing the latest technologies and systems, capable of producing extensive, diverse, and innovative pet food products. Visalia is in California’s San Joaquin Valley and the gateway to Sequoia National Park, part of the Sierra Nevada mountain range. It also has a minor league baseball team, the Visalia California Oaks, and several colleges and universities.

Responsibilities

The position of the Shipping Clerk is responsible for maintaining a high level of inventory accuracy and integrity within the facility. This position will take delivery of incoming shipments of products, organize merchandise for outbound shipments, and keep records regarding these transactions. Strict compliance with the facility Food Safety and Quality Management System Policies, Procedures, and Work Instructions is required.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Proficient in all Shipping Clerk I dutiesCapable of working independent with little to no supervisionAble to direct and train other ClerksManage all inbound/outbound shipments by:Recording shortages and eliminating damaged merchandise.Tracing missing or lost shipments.Oversees all monitoring activities to assure finished goods comply with food safety and quality specifications:Monitors incoming goods/services for possible contaminationIdentifies non-conforming productRotates product to prevent expiration. Prints/prepares all paperwork for shipment with accuracy and attention to detail:Attaches identifying information and delivery instructions on containers. Posts weights and shipment charges.Maintains shipping board in Shipping officeInspect and clear trailers for loadingSkilled in SAP and creating labels for outbound shipmentsCompetent in reading all product information on labels e.g. lot, expiration date, part number, etc.Expert in Grossman prosses related to job activities.Authenticates receipts of shipments alongside bills of lading, invoices and other records.Maintains files of shipping recordsMaintain warehouse, and its equipment and materials, in an organized and clean manner to ensure safety and good manufacturing processes. Ensures operations are conducted in a manner that promotes safety and maintains security in the warehouse. Responsible for continuous improvement ideas and implementation in assigned areaInteract with warehouse team members, quality control, and production to maximize output and efficiency.Report any food safety issues observed to manager/supervisor.Report any plant security breaches, attempts at product tampering or contamination, or other suspicious behavior observed to manager/supervisor.Complete and comply with the Master Sanitation Schedule (MSS), Daily Routine List (DRL), HACCP procedures, Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), Integrated Pest Management (IPM) Compliance.Provide back-up support for other roles as necessary. Available for overtime work on a scheduled or call-in basis as necessary. 

Other duties as assigned by the manager/supervisor.

Qualifications

Qualifications and Competencies: 

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill or ability necessary to perform this job successfully:

Education/Experience

A high school diploma or an equivalent combination of education and experienceOne year working in a warehouse environment3 years of experience as a clerk1 year SAP/Grossman
Skills

Highly skilled in computer systems.Strong organizational and detail oriented skills.Ability to perform counts using basic arithmetic skills.Must be self-motivated, proactive and able to work independently and as a team.Proficient with a scan gun.Communicates English well, both verbally and in writing.Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, Excel, Power Point, and Access).


Physical Requirements

Continuously lift and/or move objects weighing up to and including 50 pounds.Tolerance for both hot and cold environments.


Environment

Regularly exposed to work near moving mechnical parts/machinery.Regularly exposed to major amounts of dust.Regularly exposed to moderate to severe noise levels.Regularly exposed to outdoor/uncontrolled weather conditions.Ocassionally exposed to chemicals used in the manufacturing process.


Note: Valid Driver’s License required for insurance purposes. Plant Management retains the discretion to add to or change the duties of this position at any time. 

Offers of employment will be determined by factors including but not limited to job-related skills, experience, relevant education and/or training and geographical location of the open position. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristics protected by law.

Pay: The pay range for this position is $20 to $23 an hour

We offer competitive benefit plans and programs to eligible employees, including but not limited to: 

MedicalPrescription drugDentalVisionLife InsuranceDisability coverageEmployee assistance programs (includes counseling, coaching, online programs, etc.)401(k)Paid time off


Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Post Consumer Brands, we are genuinely committed to diversity, equity, AND inclusion and understand that the presence of diversity alone does not create an inclusive and equitable workplace. Furthermore, our commitment to DEI is rooted in our values and how we work. Our DEI Advisory Committee works to bring our beliefs and commitments to life through our four focus pillars: Community, Workforce, Workplace, and Marketplace.

Experience Level (if available): None
